episodeTitle: Scramble over Robin! A Cunning Plan by Sogeking!!
description: On the Puffing Tom sea train, Sogeking finally reveals himself after hiding under Robin's cloak. When CP9 eliminates Nero for his weakness, the Straw Hats witness the organization's ruthlessness. Sogeking executes a clever escape plan using a smoke bomb, temporarily rescuing Robin. However, Blueno's Air Door powers thwart their escape, and Robin herself knocks out Sogeking, refusing to be saved. Meanwhile, the Rocketman crew encounters Yokozuna the frog.

events.title: CP9 Acknowledges the Intruders' Strength
events.description: After Sanji and Franky defeated their opponents and entered train car 2, Kalifa comments on how loud it has gotten. Blueno and Kaku admit they underestimated the intruders' capabilities.
events.significance: Shows CP9 beginning to take the Straw Hats and Franky seriously as threats, setting up the escalating tension of the confrontation.

quotes.text: It's gotten quite loud. We underestimated them.
quotes.speaker: Kaku
quotes.context: Kaku acknowledges the strength of the intruders

events.title: Introduction of Nero to CP9
events.description: Rob Lucci walks toward a man named Nero, kicking an unconscious Wanze away. Kaku explains that according to Corgi, Nero is the newest member of CP9, though he only knows four of the six Rokushiki powers.
events.significance: Introduces Nero as CP9's newest recruit, establishing him as inadequate by CP9 standards. This sets up his imminent elimination by Lucci.

quotes.text: According to Corgi, he's the newest member of CP9. However, he only knows four of the six powers.
quotes.speaker: Kaku
quotes.context: Kaku explains Nero's inadequacy as a CP9 member

events.title: Lucci Eliminates Nero
events.description: When Nero emotionally attacks Franky despite orders to keep him alive, Lucci gives Nero three seconds to escape. Nero attempts to flee using Soru, but Lucci catches him effortlessly and strikes him with Shigan multiple times in the back. Lucci then throws Nero's wounded body out the window into the ocean during the Aqua Laguna storm, stating that CP9 members must master all six powers.
events.significance: This brutal execution demonstrates CP9's ruthlessness and perfectionist standards. It shows that even within the World Government's assassination unit, weakness is not tolerated. Lucci's cold efficiency establishes him as a merciless antagonist.

quotes.text: In order to be a member of CP9, one must master all of the six powers.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Lucci justifies killing Nero for his inadequacy

quotes.text: I'll give you three seconds to try and escape.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Lucci gives Nero a brief chance before executing him

events.title: Lucci Reveals Robin's True Danger
events.description: Rob Lucci tells Sanji a story about how some people are born better off dead, revealing that he's talking about an 8-year-old child - Robin. He explains that Robin received her massive bounty as a child because she has the ability to awaken the Ancient Weapons, making her entire existence a curse in the eyes of the World Government.
events.significance: This revelation provides crucial context for why the World Government fears Robin so much and why they want her dead. It explains the Ohara tragedy from the government's perspective and deepens the conflict, showing that Robin has been hunted since childhood for her knowledge.

quotes.text: Some people are born better off dead. Even if that person was an 8-year-old child, that person should be put to death. That was the story of Robin I just told. The only good Robin can do is to die, as her life is an entire curse.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Lucci explains why the World Government wants Robin dead

events.title: Robin and Sogeking Enter the CP9 Car
events.description: Suddenly, Robin appears with Sogeking, entering train car 2 where CP9 awaits. Sanji is excited to see Robin again and declares he will beat up CP9 so they can all escape together.
events.significance: This is the first direct confrontation between Robin, Sogeking, and CP9 on the train. It sets up Sogeking's rescue plan and Sanji's determination to save Robin.

quotes.text: Robin! I'll beat up CP9 so we can escape together!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's determination to rescue Robin

events.title: Sogeking Uses Smoke Star
events.description: Sogeking suddenly tells Franky to detach the train cars and instructs Sanji and Franky to run. He then tosses down his Smoke Star - a smoke bomb that creates a dense smokescreen, stunning CP9 and creating confusion in the train car.
events.significance: This is the debut of Sogeking's Smoke Star technique, showcasing his tactical thinking and resourcefulness. The smoke bomb proves effective even against elite CP9 agents, allowing for a temporary escape.

quotes.text: Franky, detach the train cars! Everyone, run!
quotes.speaker: Sogeking
quotes.context: Sogeking initiates his escape plan

events.title: Successful Temporary Escape with Robin
events.description: Taking advantage of the smokescreen distraction, Sogeking grabs Robin and runs toward the previous train car. Sanji and Franky compliment Sogeking's clever plan as he successfully makes it onto the detached train car with Robin, temporarily escaping from CP9.
events.significance: This moment shows Sogeking's growth as a strategist and his determination to save Robin. For a brief moment, it appears the rescue might succeed, raising the emotional stakes for when it ultimately fails.

quotes.text: Nice plan, Sogeking!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky praises Sogeking's tactical thinking

events.title: Blueno Uses Air Door to Retrieve the Escaped Car
events.description: The escape is short-lived as Kalifa uses her thorny whip to catch the detached train car, and Blueno uses his Doa Doa no Mi powers to pull them back. The CP9 agents demonstrate their coordination and Devil Fruit abilities to counter the escape attempt.
events.significance: Demonstrates the effectiveness of CP9's teamwork and showcases Blueno's Devil Fruit powers in action. It shows that simple tactics won't work against such skilled opponents.

events.title: Franky Sacrifices Himself
events.description: Franky knocks down the wall between train cars to create an escape route for Sogeking, Robin, and Sanji. However, in doing so, he ends up on the CP9 car himself, sacrificing his own chance at escape to save the others.
events.significance: Shows Franky's selflessness and growing connection to the Straw Hats' cause. This sacrifice demonstrates his heroic nature despite being an outsider to the crew at this point.

events.title: Blueno Opens Air Door in the Straw Hats' Car
events.description: Blueno demonstrates the full extent of his Doa Doa no Mi abilities by creating an 'air door' - opening a door in the air itself that leads to another dimension. He uses this to appear behind Sanji in the separated train car.
events.significance: This is a crucial reveal of Blueno's Devil Fruit powers, showing he can create doors anywhere, even in thin air. This ability makes escape from CP9 nearly impossible and establishes the Doa Doa no Mi as one of the most versatile Devil Fruits.

quotes.text: I ate the Doa Doa no Mi, which allows me to create doors on any surface, including the air itself.
quotes.speaker: Blueno
quotes.context: Blueno explains his Devil Fruit powers

events.title: Blueno Mentions the Buster Call
events.description: Blueno appears behind Sanji using his Doa Doa no Mi powers and warns that if there is a Buster Call, they will all be obliterated. This is an ominous foreshadowing of the catastrophic military operation.
events.significance: This is an early mention of the Buster Call that will become crucial later in the arc. It plants the seed of dread about the World Government's ultimate weapon and raises the stakes of the conflict.

quotes.text: If there is a Buster Call, you will all be obliterated.
quotes.speaker: Blueno
quotes.context: Blueno warns about the destructive power of a Buster Call

events.title: Blueno Reveals Robin's Ohara Trauma
events.description: Blueno explains to the group that the Buster Call destroyed Robin's entire island of Ohara when she was just eight years old, leaving her as the only survivor. He reveals that these horrible memories have caused Robin to turn on her friends now.
events.significance: This revelation provides crucial context for Robin's actions and trauma. It explains why Robin is so afraid of the World Government and why she believes sacrificing herself is the only way to protect the Straw Hats from the same fate that befell Ohara.

quotes.text: The Buster Call destroyed an entire island, leaving her as the only survivor at the age of eight. Those horrible memories have caused her to turn on her friends.
quotes.speaker: Blueno
quotes.context: Blueno explains Robin's traumatic past

events.title: Sogeking Encourages Robin to Have Faith in Luffy
events.description: Sogeking tells Robin that she cannot leave a pirate crew without the captain's agreement and that she should have faith in Luffy. This statement shocks Robin, momentarily making her reconsider her decision.
events.significance: This is a powerful moment showing Sogeking's understanding of crew bonds and his belief in Luffy. His words pierce through Robin's resolve and plant doubt in her mind about whether she's making the right choice. This sets up Robin's eventual realization that she does want to live.

quotes.text: You can't leave a pirate crew without the captain's agreement! You should have faith in Luffy!
quotes.speaker: Sogeking
quotes.context: Sogeking tries to convince Robin to trust in Luffy

events.title: Robin Knocks Out Sogeking with Ocho Fleur Clutch
events.description: Despite Sogeking's encouragement and successful rescue attempt, Robin uses her Hana Hana no Mi ability - Ocho Fleur Clutch - to knock out Sogeking, coldly telling him to leave her alone. She escapes before Sanji can stop her.
events.significance: This heartbreaking moment shows Robin's determination to sacrifice herself for the crew's safety. Her attack on Sogeking, who risked everything to save her, demonstrates the depth of her fear and self-sacrifice. It's a crushing blow to the rescue attempt and to Sogeking personally.

quotes.text: Leave me alone!
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin rejects the rescue attempt by attacking Sogeking

events.title: Luffy Encounters Yokozuna on the Tracks
events.description: On board the Rocketman, Luffy tells everyone about a large frog that has hopped onto the train tracks ahead. Kokoro recognizes the frog as Yokozuna and wonders why he's out there. Luffy yells at Yokozuna to move, but the frog stands his ground.
events.significance: Introduces the conflict between the Rocketman and Yokozuna, adding another obstacle to the crew's pursuit of Robin. Yokozuna's appearance connects to the Water 7 storyline and Tom's Workers.

quotes.text: Turn back! Not you guys - that giant frog!
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy warns about Yokozuna on the tracks

events.title: Yokozuna Attacks the Rocketman
events.description: Despite Luffy's warnings, Yokozuna stands his ground and prepares to knock away the Rocketman. The powerful frog attacks the train head-on, successfully knocking the Rocketman off its tracks.
events.significance: This collision creates a major setback for Luffy's group in their pursuit of Robin. Yokozuna's strength is impressive enough to derail an entire sea train, showing why he was once a sparring partner for the Sea Kings.

events.title: Enies Lobby Comes Into View
events.description: As the Puffing Tom continues on with Robin and Franky captured, the ominous silhouette of Enies Lobby - the Judicial Island - comes into view on the horizon. The final destination of CP9's journey approaches.
events.significance: This is the first glimpse of Enies Lobby in the anime, marking a major turning point in the arc. The appearance of the Judicial Island signals that the conflict is about to escalate dramatically. This moment transitions the arc from Water 7 to Enies Lobby, setting up the upcoming rescue mission.

quotes.text: According to Corgi, he's the newest member of CP9. However, he only knows four of the six powers.
quotes.speaker: Kaku
quotes.context: Kaku explains Nero's inadequacy as a CP9 member

quotes.text: In order to be a member of CP9, one must master all of the six powers.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Lucci justifies killing Nero for his weakness

quotes.text: Some people are born better off dead. Even if that person was an 8-year-old child, that person should be put to death. That was the story of Robin I just told. The only good Robin can do is to die, as her life is an entire curse.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Lucci explains the World Government's view of Robin

quotes.text: Franky, detach the train cars! Everyone, run!
quotes.speaker: Sogeking
quotes.context: Sogeking initiates his clever escape plan

quotes.text: I ate the Doa Doa no Mi, which allows me to create doors on any surface, including the air itself.
quotes.speaker: Blueno
quotes.context: Blueno explains his Devil Fruit abilities

quotes.text: If there is a Buster Call, you will all be obliterated.
quotes.speaker: Blueno
quotes.context: Blueno warns about the Buster Call's destructive power

quotes.text: The Buster Call destroyed an entire island, leaving her as the only survivor at the age of eight. Those horrible memories have caused her to turn on her friends.
quotes.speaker: Blueno
quotes.context: Blueno reveals Robin's traumatic past at Ohara

quotes.text: You can't leave a pirate crew without the captain's agreement! You should have faith in Luffy!
quotes.speaker: Sogeking
quotes.context: Sogeking tries to convince Robin to trust in Luffy

quotes.text: Leave me alone!
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin rejects the rescue and attacks Sogeking

themes.description: Robin's willingness to sacrifice herself and even attack those trying to save her demonstrates the theme of self-destructive sacrifice. She believes her death is the only way to protect her friends from the World Government.
themes.symbolism: Robin knocking out Sogeking symbolizes her pushing away those who care about her, believing isolation and sacrifice are her only options.

themes.description: CP9's elimination of Nero for failing to meet their standards shows the World Government's ruthless approach to 'justice' - even their own members are expendable if they fall short of perfection.
themes.symbolism: Nero being thrown into the stormy sea represents the World Government's willingness to discard anyone who doesn't serve their purposes.

themes.description: Sogeking's words about having faith in Luffy highlight the importance of trust between crew members. Robin's struggle is whether to trust in her captain or continue believing she must face her burden alone.
themes.symbolism: The smoke bomb creates temporary hope and clarity, but when it clears, the harsh reality remains - much like Robin's momentary consideration of trusting her friends.

themes.description: The revelation of Robin's childhood trauma at Ohara explains her current actions. Her fear of the Buster Call and losing more people she cares about drives her to push everyone away.
themes.symbolism: Enies Lobby appearing on the horizon represents Robin's past trauma catching up with her, the place where her fate will be decided.

themes.description: Sogeking's clever smoke bomb plan shows that strategy and intelligence can create opportunities even against stronger opponents, though ultimately CP9's Devil Fruit powers and coordination overcome it.
themes.symbolism: The temporary success and ultimate failure of the escape attempt shows the limits of cleverness against overwhelming power and resources.

characterSpotlights.role: Hero attempting to rescue Robin with clever tactics
characterSpotlights.development: Sogeking shows tremendous growth in this episode, demonstrating tactical thinking, bravery, and deep understanding of crew bonds. His smoke bomb plan and his words about trusting Luffy show he's matured from the Usopp who fled from conflict.
keyActions: Reveals himself from under Robin's cloak
Devises and executes the smoke bomb escape plan
Successfully grabs Robin during the confusion
Tells Robin she needs Luffy's permission to leave
Encourages Robin to have faith in Luffy
Gets knocked out by Robin's Ocho Fleur Clutch
quotes: Franky, detach the train cars! Everyone, run!
You can't leave a pirate crew without the captain's agreement! You should have faith in Luffy!

characterSpotlights.development: Robin's internal conflict is on full display. Despite being rescued, she violently rejects help, showing the depth of her trauma and her belief that sacrificing herself is the only way to protect the crew. Sogeking's words about Luffy visibly affect her, showing cracks in her resolve.
keyActions: Enters the CP9 car with Sogeking
Gets temporarily rescued by Sogeking's plan
Hears Sogeking's words about faith in Luffy
Knocks out Sogeking with Ocho Fleur Clutch
Rejects the rescue attempt
Returns to CP9's custody

characterSpotlights.role: Ruthless CP9 leader demonstrating absolute standards
characterSpotlights.development: Lucci's cold execution of Nero establishes him as utterly merciless. His explanation of Robin's 'curse' shows his unwavering belief in the World Government's justice, no matter how cruel.
keyActions: Questions Nero's presence and qualifications
Gives Nero three seconds to escape
Executes Nero with Shigan for knowing only four Rokushiki
Throws Nero's body into the ocean
Explains Robin's danger to the world
Declares Robin's existence a curse
quotes: In order to be a member of CP9, one must master all of the six powers.

Some people are born better off dead. Even if that person was an 8-year-old child, that person should be put to death. That was the story of Robin I just told. The only good Robin can do is to die, as her life is an entire curse.

characterSpotlights.role: CP9 agent demonstrating Devil Fruit mastery
characterSpotlights.development: Blueno showcases the full versatility of his Doa Doa no Mi, using it to counter every escape attempt. His explanation of the Buster Call and Robin's past shows he understands the psychological warfare aspect of their mission.
keyActions: Uses Devil Fruit to pull back the escaped train car
Creates an air door to appear behind Sanji
Explains his Doa Doa no Mi abilities
Mentions the Buster Call threat
Reveals details about Robin's traumatic past at Ohara
quotes: I ate the Doa Doa no Mi, which allows me to create doors on any surface, including the air itself.
If there is a Buster Call, you will all be obliterated.
The Buster Call destroyed an entire island, leaving her as the only survivor at the age of eight. Those horrible memories have caused her to turn on her friends.

characterSpotlights.role: Ally who sacrifices himself for others
characterSpotlights.development: Franky demonstrates his heroic nature by creating an escape route for the others while sacrificing his own freedom. This selfless act shows he's truly aligned with the Straw Hats' cause.
keyActions: Fights alongside Sanji
Compliments Sogeking's plan
Knocks down the wall to create an escape route
Ends up trapped on the CP9 car
Sacrifices his escape for the others

characterSpotlights.role: Inadequate CP9 recruit eliminated for weakness
characterSpotlights.development: Nero's brief appearance and swift execution serves to demonstrate CP9's ruthless standards and Lucci's merciless nature. His death shows that even working for the World Government offers no protection from their brutal hierarchy.
keyActions: Introduced as newest CP9 member
Revealed to know only four of six Rokushiki
Attempts to attack Franky emotionally
Tries to flee from Lucci using Soru
Gets struck down by Lucci's Shigan
Thrown into the ocean to die

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the scene of Lucci eliminating Nero with additional dramatic shots and reaction frames from the other characters.
The smoke bomb sequence by Sogeking is expanded in the anime with more detailed animation of the confusion it causes among CP9 members.
The Yokozuna encounter on the Rocketman includes additional comedic reactions from Luffy and the crew compared to the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the death of Nero, one of the few named characters to be killed by a protagonist-aligned organization (CP9) rather than enemies of the main characters.
This episode debuts Sogeking's Smoke Star technique, which becomes one of his signature tactical weapons throughout the series.
The ending theme 'Asu wa Kuru Kara' by Tohoshinki ends with episode 263, making this one of the last episodes to feature this ending song.

sources.title: Asu wa Kuru Kara - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The opening theme 'Kokoro no Chizu' by BOYSTYLE also ends with episode 263, making this episode part of the final episodes with this opening.

sources.title: Kokoro no Chizu - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This is the first anime appearance of Enies Lobby, though only as a silhouette on the horizon. The full reveal comes in the next episode.
This episode adapts Chapter 373 (pages 6-19) and Chapter 374 (pages 2-13) of the manga, covering approximately 1.6 chapters.
Lucci's statement that Robin's 'entire existence is a curse' becomes one of the most chilling villain declarations in the series, directly contrasting with the eventual 'I want to live!' moment.
The episode originally aired in Japan on April 16, 2006, during the height of the Water 7 Saga's popularity.
This episode has an IMDb rating of 8.3/10, making it one of the higher-rated episodes of the Water 7 Saga.
